title: ESA sets mid-2024 date for first Ariane 6 launch
summary: With the successful completion of a core stage hot-fire test, the European Space Agency says it now expects the first launch of the Ariane 6 to take place in the middle of 2024.

title: SpaceX acquires parachute supplier
summary: In a rare acquisition, SpaceX has purchased out of bankruptcy a company that provided components for Dragon spacecraft parachutes.

title: China is working on a design for a reusable air-launched orbital rocket
summary: A Chinese launch vehicle maker is working on designs for an air-launched rocket for sending small satellites to orbit.

title: Timeline Leading up to Maiden Ariane 6 Flight Announced
summary:
European Space Agency director general Josef Aschbacher has announced that Ariane 6 will be launched for the first time between 15 June and 31 July 2024. In addition to a specific timeframe for the rocket’s debut, Ariane 6 task force officials also outlined the timeline of expected milestones leading up to the flight. ESA had […]

title: House Committee Clears Commercial Space Bill on Partisan, But Friendly, Vote
